perturbation.original_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a joint venture (the "Venture") in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the Members will be as stated in the applicable legislation of the State of Florida (the "Act") except as otherwise provided here.
perturbation.changed_text: By this Agreement the Members enter into a joint venture (the "Venture") in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The rights and obligations of the Members will be as stated in the applicable legislation of the State of Delaware (the "Act") except as otherwise provided here.
perturbation.explanation: The 'Act' is initially defined as the laws of Florida but is then changed to the laws of Delaware. This creates a contradiction, as the venture is stated to be formed under Florida law, but then governed by Delaware law, causing uncertainty on which jurisdiction's laws apply.

perturbation.original_text:
Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value

BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD
perturbation.changed_text:
Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Initial Investment"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value

BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Capital Contribution' is changed to 'Initial Investment' in the opening sentence of the capital contribution section, but then the table still references 'Capital Contribution'. This creates a contradiction about what the initial capital is formally called, and may be confusing in later sections referring to it.

perturbation.original_text: All matters relating to this Agreement and the Venture will be treated by the Members as confidential and no Member will disclose or allow to be disclosed any Venture matter or matters, directly or indirectly, to any third party without the prior written approval of all Members except where the information properly comes into the public domain.
perturbation.changed_text: All matters relating to this Agreement and the Joint Venture will be treated by the Members as confidential and no Member will disclose or allow to be disclosed any Venture matter or matters, directly or indirectly, to any external entity without the prior written approval of all Members except where the information properly comes into the public domain.
perturbation.explanation: The phrases 'the Venture' and 'Joint Venture' are initially used interchangeably, but the term 'third party' is replaced with 'external entity'. The change creates uncertainty about the scope of confidentiality, especially if 'external entity' is interpreted differently from 'third party', thereby impacting information disclosure obligations.
